questions.question: Q1. For the purpose of mitigating this exposure, has the nature of risk been identified as foreign exchange risk?
questions.noMessage: Further Hedge Accounting assessment not supported by FXGuard

questions.question: Q2. Has the firm defined its Risk management objective and strategy? This could include why the proposed hedging objective is consistent with the firm’s risk management strategy for undertaking hedges
questions.noMessage: Risk management objective and strategy’ must be created prior to seeking Hedge accounting. Please look in the section “Sample FX Policy and Hedge Template

questions.question: Q3. Is there an economic relationship (inverse/opposite) between the hedged item and hedging instrument?
Q4. Does credit risk dominate the value changes within the economic relationship?
Q5. Does the hedge relate to an intragroup transaction for a subsidiary?
Q6. Is the item to be hedged an existing asset or liability?
Q7. Does the hedge relate to a net investment in a foreign operation?
questions.noMessage: You can achieve either “Fair Value” or “Cash Flow” Hedge Accounting
questions.yesMessage: You can achieve Net Investment Hedge Accounting

questions.question: Q8. Is the item to be hedged an unrecognised firm commitment?
questions.yesMessage: You can achieve “Fair Value Hedge Accounting”

questions.question: Q9. Is the item to be hedged a highly probable forecast transaction?
Q10. Is there an expected timeline for forecast transaction to take place?
